title: Baked Asparagus with Eggs
introduction: Baked Asparagus with Eggs, also known as Asparagi Milanese, is a delightful and simple dish that combines fresh asparagus, eggs, and Parmigiano-Reggiano. This comforting meal is perfect for any time of the day and beautifully showcases the natural flavors of its ingredients.

instructions.description: Trim off the base of the asparagus at the point where the stem turns from white to green. Bring about 2 inches of water to a boil in a large skillet. Add the asparagus and salt to taste. Cook until the asparagus bend slightly when you lift them from the stem end, about 4 to 8 minutes. Cooking time will depend on the thickness of the asparagus. Transfer the asparagus with tongs to a strainer. Drain, then pat them dry.
Place a rack in the center of the oven. Preheat the oven to 450Â°F. Butter a large baking dish.
Arrange the asparagus side by side in the baking dish, overlapping them slightly. Dot with 1 tablespoon of the butter, and sprinkle with pepper and the cheese.
Bake 15 minutes or until the cheese is melted and golden.

In a large nonstick skillet, melt the remaining 2 tablespoons butter over medium heat. When the butter foam subsides, break one egg into a cup, then carefully slide it into the pan. Repeat with the remaining eggs. Sprinkle with salt and cook until the eggs are set to taste, about 2 to 3 minutes.
Divide the asparagus among the plates. Place the eggs on top. Spoon the pan juices over the top and serve hot.
